intro: Hieracium favreanum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium favreanum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes.
